definition: to replace with sth new/to upgrade
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
out with the old and in with the new (idiom)

sentences.english: So do all who live to see such times, but that is not for them to decide.
sentences.chinese: 當局者迷，你可能並不知道該是換新工作的時候了。

sentences.english: I know my roof can be replaced.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我的屋頂可以換新。

sentences.english: Bottle turn the star moves, years alternate, old E Er is much this now is changed new colour.
sentences.chinese: 斗轉星移，歲月更迭，古老的鄂爾多斯今朝換新顏。

sentences.english: Frozen oil quality color black or impurity, criterion appropriate immediately change new.
sentences.chinese: 冷凍油的油質顏色變黑或有雜質，則宜立即換新。

sentences.english: The collet shall be renewed when it is gravely oxidated.
sentences.chinese: 如果夾頭有嚴重氧化時應換新的。

sentences.english: The inspection glass for oil level of main generator engine governor, to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 主發電機調速器用於檢查油等級的檢查玻璃需要換新。

sentences.english: Ckeck if pump works normally, repair or replace it.
sentences.chinese: 檢查油泵的工作是否正常，修理或換新的油泵。

sentences.english: Some of the cables between the motor and its controller should be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 電動機與控制器之間得一些電纜應換新。

sentences.english: We will continue to implement the policies of providing subsidies for rural residents to purchase home appliances and subsidies for trading-in old home appliances for new ones.
sentences.chinese: 繼續實施家電下鄉和以舊換新政策。

sentences.english: It is replaced by new leaves dense, shade built a whole tree.
sentences.chinese: 它換新的葉子密密麻麻，蔭蓋了整棵樹。

sentences.english: Nung-fu needs a new blade for the old shredder.
sentences.chinese: 農夫的老舊鉸碎機需換新刀片。

sentences.english: My mom is 70 years old, and she wants to trade in her old car for a new one.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽七十歲了，她想把她的車以舊換新。

sentences.english: The burnt coil should be renewed.
This is a facelift of what we already have.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個我們已經舊貌換新顏。

sentences.english: All of the machines will need new cartridges.
sentences.chinese: 所有的機器都需要換新墨盒。

sentences.english: Damages occurring to materials shall be suitably corrected or replaced with new before delivery of the vessel.
sentences.chinese: 對損壞的材料應在交船前進行適當的修正或換新。

definition: to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
to replace (a worn-out tire etc)/to change (one's address etc)
old/opposite: new 新/former/worn (with age)
to scrap/to be written off
shoot!/gosh!/oh, no!/(suffix) to the utmost
at the minimum/at the very least
to return sth/to revert
spoilt/ruined
(final particle, same as 吧)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
unalterable/certainly/definitely
to be overdue/to exceed the time limit/to expire (as in expiration date)
to dismantle/to disassemble/to open up (sth sealed)/to unpick
not to see/not to meet/to have disappeared/to be missing
to prepare/to make ready/preparation/preparatory
already
